meanings.sent1: She was fumbling with the keys, trying to unlock the door.
meanings.sent2: He always fumbles when he tries to tie his shoelaces.
meanings.sent3: While fumbling with the remote, she accidentally turned up the volume to maximum.
meanings.sent4: The magician was fumbling with his tricks, dropping cards left and right.
meanings.sent5: The new student was fumbling through the textbook, struggling to find the correct page.

meanings.definition: To make awkward attempts to do or find something.
meanings.sent1: The child was fumbling with the puzzle pieces, trying to fit them together.
meanings.sent2: She fumbled through her bag, searching for her lost pen.
meanings.sent3: He was fumbling with the new recipe, unsure of the ingredients to add next.
meanings.sent4: The detective fumbled with the evidence, trying to piece together the clues.
meanings.sent5: The explorer fumbled with the map, struggling to navigate through the dense forest.

meanings.definition: Clumsy or awkward in movement or performance.
meanings.sent1: The fumbling waiter dropped the tray of drinks on the floor.
meanings.sent2: She felt fumbling as she attempted to dance in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The fumbling juggler kept dropping the balls during the performance.
meanings.sent4: His fumbling attempts at juggling made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent5: The fumbling acrobat nearly fell off the tightrope during the show.
